subject: Programming
title: The Divide and Conquer Strategy
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Divide and Conquer Strategy.

hook.text: Napoleon won battles by splitting enemy forces and defeating each group separately.

buildup.text: Divide and conquer breaks a problem into smaller subproblems, solves each, then combines results.

discovery.text: It turns O(nÂ²) brute force into O(n log n) elegance for sorting, multiplication, and more.

twist.text: The overhead of splitting and merging can make it slower than brute force on tiny inputs.

climax.text: Knowing when to stop dividing and switch to brute force is what makes the strategy practical.

punchline.text: Break big problems into small wins.

quiz.question: What does divide and conquer do to a problem?
